The '''Mind's Eye of the Kagura''' is a technique that allows one to [[Sensing Technique|sense]] chakra from exceptional distances in great detail. These sensory capabilities bless Karin with abilities that even surpass [[dōjutsu]] with comparable powers.<ref>''[[Sha no Sho]]'', page 67</ref>

== Usage ==
By closing her eyes and opening her mind's eye, Karin is able to find and track chakra over a vast distance,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 363, pages 4-5</ref> as well as perceive any unusual chakra activity within a radius of several dozen kilometres. By focusing on a particular target, she can perceive its characteristics, location, and movements with great detail.<ref name="d3"/> She can even deduce its particular [[Nature Transformation|nature]].<ref>Sasuke Shinden: Book of Sunrise Chapter 1</ref> These attributes afford her the ability to perceive fluctuations in a person's chakra made when they are moulding it, lying, or if someone, including herself, is under a [[genjutsu]].<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 457, page 4</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 477, page 4</ref>

== Trivia ==
* The name comes from the word {{translation|[[Wikipedia:Kagura|Kagura]]|神楽|divine entertainment}}, which is a type of Japanese theatrical dance, considered by some to have been developed by the goddess [[Wikipedia:Ame-no-Uzume|Ame-no-Uzume]]. Its roots lie in certain kinds of divination and pacification of the spirits.
* In ''[[Naruto Shippūden: Kizuna Drive]]'', Karin's usage of this technique allows her to "automatically" dodge any weak attack for a limited period.
